discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
Thanks @anton-trunov and sorry for the delay.

> * `subnA`: the name was suggested by @CohenCyril in [this comment](https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/issues/212#issuecomment-420657654);

I still agree with this naming

> * `addnCAC`: I call this "central commutativity", hence the name, but I'm happy to change it to anything else (this applies to any name in this PR);

I'm not fond of the name, but I cannot find better now.

> * `addnAl`: "left cyclic associativity" (right cyclic associativity is just commutativity in this case);

The fact suffix `C` is not present disturbs me, how about `addnACl` or `addCnA`?

> * `addnCB`

Since a variable is repeated, how about `addnBn`?

> I find `addnCAC` and `addnAl` sometimes convenient because having them in the library might save several rewrites once in a while.

Sure, I am all in favor of having these little helper lemmas.

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment: @CohenCyril Thank you very much for your suggestions, I applied them in a separate commit. I also rebased and resolved conflicts in `CHANGELOG_UNRELEASED.md`.

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment: CI is green now! @CohenCyril thanks for catching the CHANGELOG bug :)

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: Woops @anton-trunov one more rebase and we're good to go.

commits.author: anton-trunov
commits.message: ssrnat: add subnA, addnCB, addnCAC, addnAl lemmas
